reviews.review: Best puzzle game ever made next to Braid.

Отличная головоломка для тех, кто любит думать. Отличная графика, динамика. Изначально игра может показаться скучной и легкой, но наберитесь терпения, все самое интересное впереди. Особенно данная игра порадует фанатов "Half life", которым в игре не хватало загадок. Многие из нас хотели бы хоть раз куда - то телепортироваться или попасть в некие порталы... Мечты сбываются! Думайте, размышляйте и создавайте порталы!
11 порталов\10

Easily one of the best games I've ever played.  I should have played it when it came out, but better late than never!  The ending song was stuck in my head for days after I finished it.  

It combines two of my favorite genres - puzzles and FPS - in a wonderful way.  Instead of shooting bullets, you use your gun to create portals that you must use in creative ways to traverse to the next level.  There are a few secrets, too, that can net you some achievments, and one of them makes the game more challenging since you have to find an object and bring it to a specific location before completing the level. 

The best part about the game, however,  is GLaDOS, who is by far one of the best video game characters ever made. Considering that you mostly hear her voice, that's pretty impressive.  She has more of a personality and background in the sequel but I like the first one a little better since you aren't aware of what she's really like at first. 

Like Half-Life 2, the game tells its story during the action instead of using cutscenes, which gives it more subtlety.  I'm not against cutscenes unless they are too long, but they do tend to make the game less immersive.  

I can't really say anything bad about this game, but if it weren't so short (it was originally part of The Orange Box package, so that's understandable) it would have been my #1 game on Steam.  I like System Shock 2 a little more, so I guess that means I have a thing for evil A.I.s.
Маленькое чудо, ставшее предвестником большого восторга.

Fantastico
The begining of an amazing game.

[B][U]The Good[/U][/B]
Pretty much everything.

For serious.  The music is catchy as hell, and I found myself singing "Still Alive" . . . well, actually, I'm not certain I've ever stopped.  The setting is a wonderful mixture of sterile and creepy before breaking apart and becoming grungy industrial and creepy, which works very well.  The story, while fairly basic, is handled expertly through the amazing characterization of GLaDOS.  The puzzles are amazingly fun to figure out as they tend to involve flinging stuff (including yourself) here and there and everywhere else.  And even if there weren't puzzles to figure out, the portal gun itself is insanely fun to fiddle around with.  You could spend hours in the game doing nothing but trying out all the cool stuff you can do with it.

[B][U]The Bad[/U][/B]
Um.  Hmm.  I would say it's too short, but honestly I felt I got more out of three hours of gameplay from Portal than I've gotten out of a lot longer times spent on some other games.  And there's always more Portal to be had in the form of Portal 2.

About the only downside I can really think of has nothing to do with the game, in fact.  It's really just that so much of it had been spoiled for me before I ever even got to play it.  For at least a few weeks after it came out, it seemed like it was the only thing anyone was talking about.  But even then, when those moments that had been spoiled popped up while I was playing, they not only didn't feel any worse off for my having known about them beforehand, they simply shone all the more for now having all the proper context to enjoy them in.

[B][U]Overall[/U][/B]
Not the best game I've ever played ever, but by gum, it's way up there.

Wichtig ist auf jeden Fall, dass man sich die Karten immer gut anschaut - es gibt viele Easter Eggs und auch Bezüge zu Half-Life!

Portal; Mother of all riddle and explorer games. This game literately tests your creativity and imagination. I found that the game play was very gripping and combined with the lovable humor, this game was one of the best gaming experiences of my life. The game was not very long, but the experience is stuck forever. If you haven't already, you should try this game!
The cake is not a lie, you just didn't get any.

Everybody loves Portal.  It's critically-acclaimed.  

Not me, though.  I played it a fair bit so I don't think I'm being unreasonable.  It's different, the portal gun is interesting, but it's just not fun.  Towards the end of my run, I was solving puzzles just through brute force because I didn't understand what the fuck was going on.  I understand how the gun works, of course.  But I was just shooting it at everything I could find hoping that it would somehow advance the level.  And even when I read a walkthrough there was one level where I did the same thing over and over constantly failing but then one time I passed.  You had to be accurate to the pixel to pass.  Fuck that shit.

Pwninator score: 4/10

「オレンジ」と「青」のポータルを利用し、異なる場所を繋ぎながらゴールを目指すパズルゲーム。シンプルな短編作品だが、チャレンジングなゲーム性は今見ても刺激的で面白い。
ストーリー性は前面に押し出していないものの、Half-Lifeシリーズと背景世界を共有しているので、時間軸や組織といった繋がりを考察する楽しみが随所にある。

Best story line I've ever witnessed, plus a funny puzzle game, all in 1.

Portal is an excellent puzzle game, with an unique game mechanic, an excellent story, and, overall, a great atmosphere. Exploring the test chambers of the mysterious Aperture Laboratories, while being constantly watched by GLaDOS, creates an atmosphere of suspense like no other. Only questions arise at each chamber, and with each of GLaDOS' comments.

The story is really good, and filled with dark themes and humour. This game's popularity (and its sequel) should speak for how good the game is, so it's kind of hard for me to describe it.

Just get it.

I Strongly recommend this game for smart people. If you're smart like Steven Hawkings or Albert Einstein, Leonardo da Vinci or even Nostradamus, then this game was made for you and if played will become your religion. For me this game was truly a learning experience, not only did I discover my low intelligence, but I also found it impossible to pass level 6, therefore I have reverted back to playing mindless games such as GTA: San Andreas which require little or no thought process at all.

                I give this game 4, no 5 Stars which looks like this: ★★★★★

Only $9.99 on Steam get it while you still have brain cells. (Its too late for me)

부족한 플레이타임을 메꾸기에 좋은 도전과제들과 챌린지 스테이지 등이 있으며, 이런 저런 모드들이 있는 것 같은데, 본인은 해보지 않고 2편으로 넘어갈 것이기에 잘은 모르겠다.

While Portal 2 was the first Portal game that I'd ever played, and recommended it to anyone surrounding me, I can't exactly say the same for Portal. I mean, I'll still recommend it as a game to play, but not as one to play before Portal 2. 

It's more challenging, and sometimes, I'll get stuck on a puzzle that frustrates me to the point where I lose interest in the game. Then there's issues with bugs and such. However, it's still quite a lovely game, and I still love GLaDOS in here (though I will always miss her snarky comments). 

But it is still the game that spawned Portal 2, so I'll love it for its flaws.

Classic Valve title. It's a brilliant game, with a really fun story. It's sequel, Portal 2, is most definitely better than this game in every aspect except the puzzles. Portal 1, despite being shorter, had more complex puzzles, and includes a couple of challenge modes which are always fun. It's definitely worth the play, although I'd only buy if it's on sale though, and definitely through the Orange box if that's still a thing. IIRC, I picked up this, along with hl2, hl2:e1 & hl2:e2 for just 5 bucks through the Orange box being on sale.

Pretty much like all valve games, great story telling, decent visuals, and amazing gameplay. Although only singleplayer it is amazing. Also when you finish the campaign, there is bonus maps to get and player made maps. Get this game if you enjoy the Halflife series, or Valve games.

One of the my favourite games ever.

You are a woman who participates in a test program.
For each test you hear a female voice telling you things.
Each new test become more difficult and sometimes more deadly.
You never see people behind the window, Are there still people in the building.
What about the cake, The voice, The test, What happened here.
There is only one way and that is Play the game and find out the truth.
